title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.3 - Compliance with employer policy
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-3.3 - Compliance with employer policy

State Regulations

To the extent that a covered employer's rules about
requesting leave are less stringent than the rules contained herein, an
employer may require an employee to comply with the employer's usual and
customary notice and procedural requirements for requesting leave, absent
unusual circumstances. Where an employee does not comply with the employer's
usual notice and procedural requirements, and no unusual circumstances justify
the failure to comply, PFL may be delayed or denied. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
380-3.3

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
